images.place: Hong Kong Garden and Dim Sum Cafe, Las Vegas, Nevada

description:
[Fish balls](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish_ball) are essentially fish meatballs, fish paste shaped into balls and boiled. They're popular in Southern China and Southeast Asia, served in restaurants and as street food. The restaurant version is made of higher quality white fish.

**Characters**

[魚蛋](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%AD%9A%E8%9B%8B) is literally *fish eggs* --  [魚](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%AD%9A) is *fish* and [蛋](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%AD%9A) is *egg*), there are no eggs involved.

images.place: Ping Pang Pong, Las Vegas, Nevada

description:
[Fish balls](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish_ball) (fish meatballs), soaked in curry.

**Characters**

[咖哩](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E5%92%96%E5%96%B1) is the [loanword](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loanword) for [curry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curry), and 魚蛋 is *fish balls* (literally *fish eggs* --  [魚](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%AD%9A) is *fish* and [蛋](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%AD%9A) is *egg*).

Deep-fried [fish balls](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish_ball) (fish meatballs), a street food, usually smaller and cheaper, than regular fish balls.

**Characters**

[炸](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E7%82%B8) is *deep-fried*, and [魚蛋](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%AD%9A%E8%9B%8B) is *fish balls* (literally *fish eggs* --  [魚](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%AD%9A) is *fish* and [蛋](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%AD%9A) is *egg*).
